Fields.DialogueText: Capitán, you wanted to see me?

Fields.MenuText: I did?
Yes, I did.
No. You must be mistaken.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose. That's what I heard, at least.
What's going on?
All right... I suppose I'll be on my way, then?
I picked up a little present for you while I was in Cartagena.
¿Un regalo? Well, give it to me! I hope you're not expecting me to wait forever!
Calm down, I said a little present. Don't expect anything too grand.
It's always fun to get a gift. No matter what it turns out to be. The surprise is the exciting part.
Here, it's...
*ALARM*
Well, that figures.
The Morganas can wait a second. I'll open it really fast!
It'll be here after the battle. Priorities, Velasco.
*sigh* Can't argue with that logic. You're right again, Capitán.
@BATTLE
Either way, it's good you're here.
It's nothing serious, really. I just have something to give you.
No, wait! Before you go, I have something for you.
Capitán. Present. I'm waiting.
What?
Mi regalo. You said I could have my present after the battle. The battle's over... and I still don't have my present.
Oh, right. I'll go get it for you. But stop raising your expectations.
I don't know what you're talking about. I'm just going to stand here with my eyes closed and hands out, waiting patiently.

Fields.MenuText: I'll be back in a moment.
I see you peeking.
I'm going to have to drop off some paperwork before I get back to you...

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm, that's a very pretty box you have in your hands.
Fine, I'll actually close my eyes.
Don't mess with me! What, do you want another Morgana to interrupt us?
All right, here.
Can I open my eyes now?
Yes, of course. And open the box too, while you're at it.
Oh! It's wonderful! Do you know what these are?
The guy I bought them from said it was a string of Trasmeran Bells. I'm no expert, but I assumed he was telling the truth. Did I overpay?
No, he was honest. These are beautiful pieces of art. And their chimes are delightful.
I'm glad you like them. I figured they'd be perfect for you.
Oh, really? Why?
You're always running around, so they'll constantly be ringing.
I would never have thought of that. I've got to go try them out right away!
*ALARM*
Sounds like you'll have to test them out in battle first.
Capitán, don't be ridiculous. I can only shake them so much. They'll never ring louder than gunfire.
@BATTLE
Hey, what happened to eyes closed?
Ha!
*CHIME*
Velasco?
*CHIME*
Velasco?!
Hmmm? Oh, sorry. Lo siento, Capitán, but I didn't hear you.
I can see that.
You know, I have a lot of work to do, so would you mind...

Fields.MenuText: Playing with your bells elsewhere?
Giving me some space?
Bothering someone else?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh? I like your thinking. I should share the joy with the rest of the ship.
Oh, sure. I was getting a little antsy anyway.
Fine! I didn't know I was such a bother!
Buying those bells might have been a mistake.
Captain, we have Morganas headed this way.
I'm sorry, what? I couldn't hear you.
Morganas!
They must've heard the bells. Let's alert the ship and get ready.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I wonder what the capitán is doing... *chime* I should check in!
Wait, no. I should let the capitán have a little space. *chime* I'm sure capitán work involves a lot of important, time consuming tasks.
Maybe I'll just take a run around the ship *chime* and see what everyone is up to. Zoom!
*CRASH*
Owww...
Oh, I'm so sorry! I didn't see you there. Are you you all right?
I'm fine. I guess I should've heard you coming. The bells you're wearing should have warned me.
Oh, I knocked all your papers down. Lo siento - let me help you with that.
Um, no! Please don't. I can handle it.
It's no trouble! I can help. Interesting papers...
It's all right; I've already got it.
All right, well, I'm Velasco. I'm sorry about that again, but it's nice to meet you.
*ALARM*
Oh, uh, that's the alarm! I need to go.
Hmmmm... Next time, you're not getting away that easily.
@BATTLE
Hello, Velasco! I followed the sound of bells, and here you are...

Fields.MenuText: How are you two getting along?
Is there a problem here?
Did I hear a crash?

Fields.DialogueText: No hay problema, Capitán. We're fine...
Ensign Namela and I just... bumped into each other, Capitán.
Nothing to worry about, Capitán. One of us was careless, but we'll soon take care of it...
Rain or shine, that fresh sea air is always delightful.
*CHIME*
Oh, and I'm about to have some company, by the sound of it.
Capitán!
Ah, Velasco, what a surprise. Enjoying the weather?
Yeah, whatever, it's fine. Who's that?
That ensign on the deck?
Sí, Capitán. I'm not familiar with her.
I think she's one of the new recruits.

Fields.MenuText: That's Lucinda Franklin. I hear she's actually a magical wizard on the run from demons who want to use her powers to take over the world.
This is a big ship, Velasco. I can't remember everyone's name.
Other than that, you'd probably have to ask her.

Fields.DialogueText: I know that's not true, but be careful what you wish for. Morganas are spooky enough. We don't need demons and wizards on top of that.
That's a horrible thing to hear from my capitán.
The direct approach... interesting.
I've been asking around the ship about her and I haven't learned much. She seems to keep to herself.
Why do you care?
I think she's a spy.
*ALARM*
That's what this is about? I hope you can put your investigation on hold while we fight some Morganas.
I'll always have time for fighting!
@BATTLE
Velasco, what are you doing up there?
Shhhhh, Capitán, I'm staying hidden. This way she can't see me watching her.
Who?
The spy.

Fields.MenuText: Seriously? You're still on this?
Oh, right. Your mystery girl.
Oh, fun. I'll come up and join you.

Fields.DialogueText: Sí, this is important. You don't want an enemy soldier this close to you, do you?
She won't be a mystery for long. I have binoculars and I'm keeping notes.
No, that'll just draw attention. Just stay down there and act nonchalant.
So then, what have you learned?
Well, I've learned it's easy to get a suntan up here.
So... nothing.
Yet.
*ALARM*
Well, you can go back to watching the crew after we deal with more pressing matters.
@BATTLE
How's the spying going today, Velasco?
Look at her. See what she's doing?

Fields.MenuText: It looks like she's feeding the seagulls.
She's writing in a notebook.
Say it isn't so! She's working with the birds to design a bomb in her notebook!

Fields.DialogueText: Sí - but see what's in her hands? She's writing in a notebook too.
Sí - and look how close she's keeping to those birds!
You joke, but for all we know, that might not be far off.
So she likes animals and keeps a diary? That's not exactly villainous.
I think she's writing notes and then using the birds to deliver them to her contacts.
That's a little crazy, Velasco.
Crazier than evil ship-spirits appearing out of nowhere, Capitán?
I see your point.
*ALARM*
Speaking of which, it sounds like I should come down from up here.
Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Capitán, I'd like to show you the findings of my investigation.

Fields.MenuText: Go ahead, I'm interested to see what you've found.
If you must.
Is there anything I could say that would convince you to do otherwise?

Fields.DialogueText: Gracias, Capitán.
I do.
No, this is a serious matter, Capitán.
I've been watching that officer for a while now, and she has been acting suspicious.
She spends most of her free time alone or in her room. She performs all of her duties on the ship very well, perhaps a little... too well.
And then there's...
One question.
¿Sí?
What's her name?
Name? Um... I don't know...
Velasco, none of this matters until you actually talk to her. Maybe she has an explanation.
Or a lie.
Just try it.
What if she's dangerous?
*ALARM*
She can't be more dangerous than the Morganas approaching.
I'm really getting tired of that alarm.
Well, if we defeat all the Morganas, then we'll stop hearing it.
@BATTLE
Velasco's still up there.
I don't know why my Belle is so suspicious of this officer. From the sound of it, that officer's probably just shy.
If she's not going to talk to her, I might as well.
Excuse me, Ensign?
Oh, hello, Captain. Do you need something?

Fields.MenuText: Are you a spy?
I don't think we've been properly introduced. I'm the captain.
I apologize, I can't remember your name, Officer...

Fields.DialogueText: A spy? No. Of course not.
Of course, Captain. Everyone knows who you are.
That's all right, I tend not to stand out.
I'm Ensign Namela. I joined the crew not too long ago. Is there something you need, Captain?
No, no, I just thought it best that we have the chance to speak; crew camaraderie, and all that, of course.
I've seen you on deck a few times. You've always seemed quite engrossed in that notebook of yours.
Oh, it's nothing, really. I was just drawing.
Drawing?
I like to draw. I draw whatever I see. Birds, waves, other ships.
Captain, we have Morganas coming from the west!
You draw those too?
Sometimes.
Well, let's give you another opportunity, after we remind these Morganas that they ought to leave us be.
@BATTLE
I saw you talking to the spy.

Fields.MenuText: She's not a spy.
You were completely right. She's a spy.
I don't know what you're talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: How do you know?
Really?
I saw you through my binoculars. I saw everything.
She's clearly just shy. I don't think spies can be shy. It seems like it'd get in the way of the job.
What's in the book? Is she using the birds to deliver messages? Why does she spend so much time alone? There are too many unanswered questions.
They all have answers. Her name is Carmen Namela. She's just a shy girl who likes to draw. And honestly, I don't think there's such a thing as messenger seagulls.
What did she do to attract this much attention from you?
She was acting suspicious.
By?
She wouldn't let me... help pick up notebook and papers. Which I suppose isn't that... suspicious.
Yeah, now you're getting it.
Well, this is embarrassing.
Captain, we have Morganas approaching from the south.
Um, hi?
I'm... going to sound the alarm, Captain.
See that? She didn't even look at me.
I'd have trouble looking at someone who'd been constantly stalking me.
She hasn't seen me... I don't think.
Were you wearing your bells?
Of course, I'd never take them off.
Oh...
Yeah, they're pretty loud.
*ALARM*
But not as loud as that alarm. Let's get ready.
@BATTLE
No.
All right, but she's not a spy.
How do you know?
Hello to you, too, Velasco.
And?
Captain, do you have a second?
Ah, it's nice to see you again. Come in.
You remember me?

Fields.MenuText: Of course, Ensign Namela. I am your captain, after all.
Of course, Ensign Nelama. I am your captain, after all.
More or less. I'm not the best with names, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Most of my superior officers have never bothered to remember me. Thank you, Captain.
It's Namela, actually, but thank you for trying, Captain.
That's all right. It happens all the time.
I just wanted to show you the drawing I finished. I drew one of the Morganas we fought earlier.
Oh, you actually drew it? I'd love to see it.
Capitán, we have- Oh! Hola, Alférez...
Oh. Hello, Miss Velasco. Captain, another time perhaps? I just remembered I have duties to attend to.
... See what I mean? Suspicious!
Did you need something?
We have Morganas headed toward us.
They never give up.
@BATTLE
Certainly, Ensign Namela.
Ensign Namela!
Oh, hello, Captain. Do you need something?
I didn't get to see your drawing before. I was hoping you could show it to me now.
Oh, sure, just let me find the page. It should be somewhere... here it is. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: It looks great. It really captures the Morgana's defeat.
Is it a... chicken? With a hat?
It's a little rough, but you definitely have some talent.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I tried to capture that "running scared" energy you mentioned before. Still, I know it could be improved upon.
No... it's a Morgana. Is it really that bad?
I know I'm no professional or anything. It's just a hobby.
Looks great to me. Do you have any others we could see?
Oh, uh, um, uh, thanks, but...
Woah! Velasco, where did you come from?
I took off my bells, like you suggested. Good luck hearing me sneak around now!
I should go.
Come on, I want to see more of your drawings.
*ALARM*
Oh, that's the alarm. We should prepare.
Get to battle stations, Ensign Namela.
Capitán, why doesn't she like me?
That's a question you should ask her, not me. But we have more pressing matters, Velasco.
Got it. Let's take these Morganas out quickly.
@BATTLE
Ensign Namela's feeding the birds again. Didn't you want to ask her something?
I'm not sure that I should. She's clearly avoiding me, and now that I know she's not a spy... maybe I should just leave her alone.

Fields.MenuText: That might be for the best.
I think maybe you should clear the air with her. You are on a ship together.
I honestly couldn't care less.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, Capitán. I should go talk to her.
You're right, Capitán. I should go talk to her.
You're right, Capitán. I should go talk to her.
I'll be right back! Don't do anything interesting without me.
Don't run! She's drawing birds, and you'll scare... Ah, never mind.
Ms. Namela, how are you? This weather is something, isn't it?
Don't fly away, birds! I wasn't finished drawing...
What are you up to today?
Oh, um, hello... Velasco... I was just leaving. Goodbye.
No, you don't.
What?
Why don't you like me? You're always running away from me and barely looking at me. I'm not scary. I'm super cute.
Um... you're very... you're very intimidating.
Intimidating? I'm not intimidating.
Incoming Morganas from the northwest!
All right, I'm going to go kick in this Morgana's teeth. Then we can talk more about how not-at-all intimidating I am.
OH!
¡No tengas miedo! That was just a joke! It was supposed to be cuteeee!
@BATTLE
That's not what I said at all.
Good. Just try not to scare her away.
Not what I said, but all right.
Am I intimidating?!

Fields.MenuText: Take all my money, just please don't hurt me!
No, of course not. You're adorable. Like a kitten. A kitten with big guns.
I hope so. I want those Morganas running scared.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitán, I'm being serious. Put your money away.
That's exactly right. A cuddly bundle of artillery and cuteness.
Well, you have a point there. But shouldn't the Morganas be the only ones who find me intimidating? Everyone else should love me.
Where's all this coming from, Velasco?
I asked Ensign Namela why she didn't like me. She told me I was intimidating.
Oh, well, that's not so outlandish.
But I'm a sweet and adorable kitty cat!
And the majority of the time you've known her, you've overwhelmed her with attention. Some of it good; some of it bad. Anyone would be intimidated by that.
All right, so I just have to show her a little restraint. Then she'll love me.
*ALARM*
You can give that a try after we utilize your scary side and take out a few Morganas.
Yes, Capitán! Let's show them this kitty's got claws!
@BATTLE
Capitán? Capitán? HEY! Capitán!
Hola, Ensign! It's been a little while since I saw you last. Your hair looks gorgeous today.
Um, thanks, but... all this ocean water does terrible things to my hair. Hats are my only saving grace.
Nonsense! Tu cabello es muy lindo. Oh, and I love what you're wearing today.
My uniform? I wear it everyday...
Well, you're wearing it very well today.
Ummm...
¿Sí? Do you have something you want to say?
Can I... can I leave now?
Yes, fine.
That got me nowhere.
Ms. Velasco.
You're back! Would you like to... get something to eat or something?
Um, we have Morganas headed this direction. I thought you should know. I, I have to go.
Damn, so close.
@BATTLE
Velasco?
Capitán! Did you see me talking to Ensign Namela? What did you think?

Fields.MenuText: Great effort! I'm proud of you, Velaco.
You made it worse.
That was certainly an interesting... effort.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh. That bad, huh?
You think so? I'm not so sure.
It was so awful! She's going to HATE ME FOREVER! Waaaaah!
Capitán, I need help. Ensign Namela won't stand still long enough for me to win her over.

Fields.MenuText: How am I supposed to help with that?
So you want me to hold her down while you force her to like you?
All right, I'm on board. I'll grab the handcuffs.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you are the capitán.
No, of course not. I'm pretty sure that would only make her more scared of me.
Handcuffs? What are you doing with handcuffs?
I was just thinking maybe you could order her to stand still while I charm her.
Right. I'm sure that will work.
Captain, we've spotted Morganas on the horizon.
Sound the alarm.
So do you want to enact your charm offensive before or after we deal with these Morganas?
After, obviously.
Just making sure.
@BATTLE
Captain, you needed to see me?
Yes, please come in and sit down. This'll just take a moment.
All right, what did you need from me?
Oh, I didn't need anything.
I did.
Oh, um, hello...
Hey, stop looking away from me! I'm not doing anything intimidating!
Don't be quiet. I just want to know how I'm so scary to you. Am I doing something? Is this about the whole stalking you with binoculars thing?
The... the what?
It's been ages since I thought you were a spy. I'm sorry, really I am.
I just... uh...

Fields.MenuText: Velasco just wants to be your friend.
I think Velasco's whole point is that she isn't as scary as she seems.
Could you tell Velasco why you don't like her so she can stop whining?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's right. I just want to be friends.
I'm not scary at all. I just want you to like me.
I'm not whining! I just want don't want my own crew to be afraid of me.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to make you think I feared you or anything like that. I just find you intimidating.
But not in a scary way?
Not so much. You're intense and, clearly, very powerful. But you're also beautiful and cheerful.
Basta - you're making me blush.
*ALARM*
Well, this has all been very touching, and it seems like you two have more to talk about. However, for now, it sounds like we have other things to worry about.
With your leave, I'll head for my post.
I'll go with you!
@BATTLE
You just want to be friends?
You want me to like you?
I'm... I'm not really afraid of you.
You two look like you're getting along now.
Yeah, we were just feeding the birds. Did you know that they don't fly away if you approach them calmly?
I had to hold her in place to keep her from running at them full speed.
You must be strong if you can hold Velasco back.
Of course, I could've become immaterial at any time, but I thought that would've been a little rude.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds a bit like cheating.
Just one more natural talent to utilize on the battlefield.
If you stayed immaterial, the birds might not have even noticed you.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's exactly what I mean.
But this wasn't exactly a battlefield, Capitán.
That's a good idea, I'll keep that in mind next time.
*ALARM*
Oh, Captain, that's the alarm!
And it scared all the birds away!
I'm sure they'll come back after we run the Morganas off.
@BATTLE
Capitán, look what Namela drew for you!

Fields.MenuText: Velasco, in case you hadn't noticed, you're screaming. Please calm down.
Let me guess. Another picture of defeated Morganas?
I'm going to guess it's a self portrait, but through the eyes of a seagull.

Fields.DialogueText: Just look at it already!
It might be. What do you think?
I... I honestly don't know why you would guess that. Here, just look.
Oh, that's excellent, actually. She's really improved since her last picture.
I know, hasn't she? Can you believe I had to steal this from her to show you?
Wait, you stole this?
She was too embarrassed to show you herself, so I crept into her room and took it. Don't tell her, all right?
That's a little out of line, Velasco.
But it's so good, Capitán. I just wanted you to see how good she was.
Well, I have to admit, she certainly has talent. And I may have an idea for her and her art.
Are you going to share these plans of yours? Sneaky Capitán.
Captain, we have Morganas headed this direction. Oh, hello, Velasco.
Oh, um, hello, Namela. Don't pay any attention to the Belle sinking through the floor. You didn't see anything.
What was that about, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe she had to use the head?
She definitely wasn't trying to hide something. I can tell you that much.
What was what about? I didn't see anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Do Belles... do that?
Um... all right?
But she just...
Let's get ready for those Morganas!
@BATTLE
All right, Capitán, you stand guard here. If you see Namela coming, give me the signal and stall her.
Why do you need me here again? You didn't need me when you stole the picture in the first place.
But now she's suspicious! I don't want her to catch me sneaking in her room. She may not have hated me before, but she could hate me for this.

Fields.MenuText: She seems like the forgiving type.
At least you didn't wear your bells today.
You're right. I'd hate you if I was her.

Fields.DialogueText: Probablemente tengas razón - but I don't want to risk it. This is easier.
No, but I'll put them on as soon as we're done here. It'll make me seem more innocent.
Don't say that! You're making me feel even worse.
Just watch the door, I'll only take a second.
How hard can it be to put back a piece of paper?!
Oh, shoot, that's Ensign Namela. What was that signal phrase again?
Hello, Captain. What are you doing at my door?
Just... testing each of the doors on this level. You hear that knock? It's a bit off kilter. It sounds a bit like "Cantabria," you know what I mean?
Not really, Captain. If you're done with your test, though, could you let me into my room? I need to get something.
Oh, this is your room? I had no idea. What are you getting?
Just my art supplies. I wanted to practice drawing water. Is that all right, Captain?
*ALARM*
Oh, well, not now. That's the alarm, so you can draw after we take care of whatever Morganas are headed this way. Now go on, get ready.
Um... all right?
Velasco! Hurry up in there! We have to get to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Capitán? You asked to see us?

Fields.MenuText: I remember asking for Ms. Namela. You can feel free to leave, Velasco.
Yes, I wanted to discuss something important with Namela about her drawings.
Oh, that's right. I did. Come in, come in, please.

Fields.DialogueText: So funny! I know you didn't mean that. You love my company.
Really?
What's going on?
I was wondering, Ms. Namela, do you only work with pencil and paper? Or do your artistic talents venture elsewhere?
Um... I prefer drawing, but I've worked with watercolors, charcoal, and paint. I've done some sculpting, too. Is that what you meant?
Yes, that answered my question, but now I have another one. Would I be able to commission something from you?
Commission? Like pay me to draw something for you? Captain, you don't have to pay me to draw for you.
Well, it's quite a large project. I wouldn't feel right if I didn't compensate you in some way.
Oh, a large project. I like the sound of that.
How big are we talking?
Hm... Let's see... How big is the deck?
The deck? You mean, the whole deck?!
Captain, pardon my interruption, but we have Morganas approaching. I was about to sound the alarm, but I figured you might like a heads up.
Thank you.
We'll finish this conversation later, Ensign Namela. I hope you'll give it some serious consideration.
Thank you, Captain. I'll certainly think about it.
@BATTLE
I'd prefer it if she could stay, Capitán. If that's all right.
If that's what you want.
About my drawings?
About how awesome they are, right?
In a way.
Do either of you remember what it was I wanted to talk to you about?
No, I was just told that you asked to see me.
Didn't you mention something to me about her drawings?
Ah, yes, of course.
Reporting as ordered, Captain.
Are you sure you want to do this?
You're the one who's been convincing me that I should. Now you're trying to talk me out of it?
I don't want you to do it because I told you to. I want you to WANT to do it, entiendes?
I don't know what I want.
I'm glad to see you've been putting some thought into my proposition.
Yes, we've been arguing back and forth for a while.
But in the end, we've decided we're going to do it, Capitán!
You can't decide these things for me, Velasco!

Fields.MenuText: Too late, she said it! you're in!
She's right, Velasco. She has to decide for herself.
Give her a break. She just wants what's best for you.

Fields.DialogueText: What... but... I... All right, fine, Captain.
Thank you, Captain, but... I think she's right. I'm going to do it.
Yes, I know she does. That's why I'm going to do what she wants me to do.
That's fantastic! This is going to be the best... whatever ever!
That brings up a good point. You never really explained what exactly you wanted me to do.
I want you to paint something on the deck. I don’t know what, but I want it to be a spectacle that can inspire the crew.
Well, how about a mural? I saw some in Mexico a couple years ago, it’s a beautiful art fom.
Excellent idea! Velasco, what do you think?
I love it! What could be on the mural, though?
*ALARM*
Perfect timing. Pay attention, Ensign Namela. I want you to pay close attention during this coming battle.
As we defeat these Morganas, and blast a few picturesque holes in their malformed hulls, I want you to transfer the emotion of that victory onto the deck.
Fantastic idea, Capitán! Let's help her make a painting the crew can look upon with pride!
@BATTLE
Looking good! I'm surprised you gotten this far in such a short amount of time.
Velasco has been a great help. She finished the outline before I even gathered all the paint.
That was the fun part. I got to run and jingle all around the deck with a paint can.
Do we have a picture of what it'll look like when it's finished?
Oh, yes, it's right here, Captain!
Hey, watch it! You got paint in my hair! Does this wash out?
I'm sorry, Velasco. And, uh... I don't know. Maybe it will wash out...
Oh, maybe, huh? Well, let's see how you like it.
Hey, don't splash that one me! At least mine was an accident!
Oh, was that an accident, too?
Nope! Hahaha!

Fields.MenuText: This looks like fun. Paint fight!
All right, I see you two have this under control. I'll just leave you to it.
What are you two, children?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitán, don't just throw paint straight from the bucket!
See you, Capitán!
No, this is just part of our creative process.
You have to flick it from the brush. Like this!
I am your commanding officer. I'll do what I like!
It'll look great, trust us!
I have the utmost faith in the two of you.
Yeah, it's a very creative process!
Just don't get in the way of the rest of the crew. If I see the deck embroiled in the thralls of a paint war, I will be livid.
And you might want to get cleaned up soon.
What's the hurry, Capitán?
It's heading this way and it rhymes with "More Saunas." Need more than one guess?
@BATTLE
Phenomenal, Ensign Namela! This is your best piece so far.
I think it'll be my best piece period. I can't fathom how I'd go around beating something like this.
We would need a bigger ship.
Wow, this looks awesome. Great job, Namela.
Oh, um, thanks... it's nothing, really.
If that's "nothing," I'd love to see what "something" is!
Heh, that's... kind of you to say. If you'll all excuse me, I have some paintbrushes I need to clean.
I'll be right behind you in a second, Namela!
Whoa, a mural? This is new.
Yeah, Namela and Velasco have been working on it.
Well, it's great. Is it based on one of the Morganas we fought?
Definitely. You see those holes? Those have to be from Velasco's artillery.
Yeah, I did blast a few impressive holes in that one.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: What do you all say? Want to give Namela something else to draw?
Everyone ready to make the Morganas look even worse than they do on our deck?
Oh no! We're all going to die!

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, let's give her a good model!
Let's turn them into Swiss cheese!
Yeah, right! Very funny, Captain! We won't even break a sweat!
Then let's go, already! We'll meet them head on!
@BATTLE
Capitán, do you have a moment to spare?

Fields.MenuText: For you? Always.
For you? I'm really busy.
And you are?

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks. It means a lot that you're always here for me when I need you.
Very funny. I know you always have time for me.
Oh no, your eyes must be going as well as your brain. I'll go get the ship's doctor.
So what do you need, Velasco?
I just wanted to thank you.
You are very welcome. But what for?
I wanted to thank you for being my friend. I've been coming to you for help for a long time now. And if it wasn't for you, I'm not sure I'd be doing as well as I am now.
Well, you don't have to thank me for that. If we're really friends, then you shouldn't feel like you need to thank me for anything.
You're right, Capitán, but I still wanted to. I'm glad I've gotten to know you. I appreciate you helping me make friends amongst the crew.
It's been my pleasure.
*ALARM*
Now, as friends, can we go defeat whatever godforsaken Morgana is setting off that evil alarm?
Oh, that reminds me, I asked Namela to pick something up for you. Espero que los disfrutes.
Earplugs! I think we're best friends now.
@BATTLE
Har.
See, you're not the only one who can be sarcastic.
